Articles.Content: I like for my missions to be as grounded in realism as possible and so an emergency self-destruct system is a definite must-have! Maybe something that just adds in a series of small to medium-ish explosive charges. TAC Self Destruct isn't really what I have in mind though, because they aren't really explosives more than just cheats that cause the parent part to explode. I'm looking for actual bomb-like systems that need careful calculation for how much force is needed to blow up the desired part. Do I need to stick with improvisation with BDA or is there something like this out there? Or have I completely misunderstood how TAC-SD works lol

KIS/KAS has C4 explosives that need to be triggered by an EVA kerbal, and they let you set fuse time and blast radius.

Or do you need something remotely triggered?

KSPIE has a self-destruct button on antimatter container. All you need is a bit of antimatter and press the self destruct button to go kaboom. It can also happen spontaneously if you poke the container or forget to feed it with enough power.
